No Poverty.reason: Insurance provides a financial safety net against risks that can lead to poverty. The course covers "socially responsible... issues," which can be inferred to include financial inclusion.

Quality Education.reason: As a university course, its purpose is to provide high-quality education, enabling students to "acquire advanced knowledge in risk management and insurance."
evidence: Students will acquire advanced knowledge in risk management and insurance.

Decent Work and Economic Growth.reason: The course prepares students with "professional skills" for the insurance industry, a key economic sector. Risk management is fundamental to economic stability and growth.

Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure.reason: The course explicitly includes "Engineering insurance case analysis," which is vital for infrastructure projects, and covers "product design," which relates to innovation in the industry.

Reduced Inequalities.reason: The course addresses "significant social issues" and "socially responsible... issues," which can be inferred to include the role of insurance in mitigating financial disparities.

Sustainable Cities and Communities.reason: The curriculum includes case analyses of "Fire insurance," "Automobile insurance," and "Engineering insurance," all of which are relevant to urban safety, transport, and infrastructure.

Responsible Consumption and Production.reason: A core competency is to "understand and identify ethical, socially responsible, and sustainability issues," directly addressing responsible business practices within the insurance industry.

Partnerships for the Goals.reason: The study of "Reinsurance" involves partnerships between insurers to manage risk on a global scale, reflecting the collaborative nature of this goal.
